alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Knox; Peoria; Stark (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 2:24PM CDT until March 31 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lincoln has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Fulton County in west central Illinois... Southwestern Stark County in north central Illinois... Southern Knox County in west central Illinois... Northwestern Peoria County in central Illinois... * Until 315 PM CDT. * At 224 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near London Mills, or 17 miles south of Galesburg, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Maquon and Gilson around 235 PM CDT. Yates City around 240 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Williamsfield, Elmore, Laura, West Jersey and La Fayette. This includes Interstate 74 between mile markers 54 and 72. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central, north central and west central Illinois. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central, north central and west central Illinois.
